ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Schwannoma (Right)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Asymmetric SNHL, progressive loss, positive reflex decay, and eventual MRI confirmation of CP angle lesion.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Presbycusis/Hereditary)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Underlying bilateral high-frequency loss and family history suggest a genetic or age-related component.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Eustachian Tube Dysfunction (Right)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Transient negative middle ear pressure and conductive component noted at the second visit.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and configuration.
To evaluate word recognition ability and check for retrocochlear signs (rollover).
Follow-up to monitor progression of hearing loss.
Follow-up assessment of middle ear status.
Follow-up to check for retrocochlear signs.
Long-term monitoring of functional speech perception.
To visualize the cerebellopontine angle and internal auditory canal for tumor confirmation.
To verify hearing aid fitting and performance.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation revealed mild-to-moderate bilateral sensorineural hearing loss with high-frequency asymmetry (Right worse at 6-8 kHz). Speech recognition was excellent bilaterally, and immittance testing was normal, though the asymmetry warranted monitoring.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild to moderate bilateral SNHL; Right ear worse at 6000-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: WRS 96% bilaterally; SRTs consistent with pure tones.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal ipsilateral and contralateral thresholds; negative decay.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up 3-4 years later showed significant progression of hearing loss in the right ear with a slight conductive component due to negative pressure. Right word recognition declined, and retrocochlear signs (elevated reflexes, positive decay) emerged, prompting medical referral.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear significant decrease in thresholds; slight conductive component (15-20 dB) at low frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right WRS declined to 80% at 90 dB HL and 64% at 100 dB HL; Left WRS normal.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear negative pressure (-140 daPa); Left ear normal.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right contralateral reflexes elevated; positive reflex decay at 1000 Hz in Right ear.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Six years post-Gamma Knife treatment, the right ear progressed to severe-to-profound sensorineural hearing loss with very poor word recognition. The left ear remained stable. This progression is consistent with the long-term effects of radiation on the auditory nerve.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear severe-to-profound SNHL; Left ear stable.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right WRS 18% at 95 dB HL; Left WRS 84%.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Acoustic reflexes absent (ipsi/contra) while overall immittance battery incomplete.

counseling_actions: Discuss treatment options for acoustic tumor: observation, surgery, or Gamma Knife radiation
Counsel on the likelihood of continued hearing loss progression following radiation therapy
Explain the benefits of BiCROS technology for unilateral severe/profound hearing loss
Review realistic expectations for amplification given the retrocochlear pathology

escalation.rationale_short: Evaluation and management of right vestibular schwannoma confirmed by MRI.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor tumor size via MRI and assess hearing thresholds and functional communication status.

expected_outcome: Gamma Knife treatment successfully arrested acoustic tumor growth.
Patient successfully wears a wireless digital left BTE BiCROS hearing aid.
